p: Yerba mate (YM) ( Ilex paraguariensis) is a plant that originates from Uruguay, Paraguay, Brazil, and Argentina. In the study concerning yerba mate ( I. paraguariensis), polysaccharide was extracted from leaves of this plant, and its chemical structure was defined as RG-I. An anti-inflammatory effect of RG-I could be verified by its capacity to reduce the tissue expression of inducible nitric oxide synthase (iNOS) and cyclooxygenase-2 (COX-2), and a possible subsidiary ability to treat sepsis [ 32]. Furthermore, the yerba mate RG-I contributed to suppress the gastric lesions stimulated by ethanol in rats [ 33].
